questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Which two items represent features of VM-FEX with Cisco Nexus 5500? (Choose two)

discussion.content:
If the transport is not multicast enabled, an alternative deployment model is available starting from NX-OS release 5.2(1), where one (or more) OTV edge device can be configured as an "Adjacency Server" to which all other edge devices register and communicates to them the list of devices belonging to a given overlay.

Source: https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/solutions/Enterprise/Data_Center/DCI/whitepaper/DCI3_OTV_Intro/DCI_1.html

questions.question_text:
Scenario -
Review topology and screenshots, and then answer questions that validate your knowledge of Cisco Nexus Switches.
//IMG//


Instructions -
To access the multiple-choice questions, click on the numbered boxes on the left of the top panel.
Review the Exhibit associated with the question.
There are four multiple-choice questions with this task.
Be sure to answer all four questions before selecting the Next button
//IMG//

//IMG//

Refer to the figure in Exhibit 3. Which item is uniquely required when OTV is configured to use a Unicast Control Pane?

choices.D: Enable Classical Ethernet MAC learning on Edge Interfaces.

questions.question_text: Which two descriptions of stateful packet inspection are true? (Choose two.)

choices.A: provides reliable access control for Layer 3 and Layer 4
choices.E: provides reliable access control for Layer 5, Layer 6, and Layer 7
choices.C: relies on only static rules that describe which packets should be allowed or dropped

questions.question_text: Which three options are benefits of Small Computer System Interface? (Choose three.)

discussion.content: ABC? or cisco wants us to say ACD?

choices.A: SCSI transport protocol that operates over TCP
choices.F: SCSI transport protocol that operates over UDP
choices.D: Applicable for smaller environments (small and medium-sized businesses [SMBs])

questions.question_text: Which two actions are performed at the aggregation layer? (Choose two.)
